newsArray.title: Anushka Sharma Disappointed After Virat Kohli And RCB Get Knocked Out Of IPL 2024 Post Defeat To RR. Video Goes Viral- WATCH
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: Anushka Sharma Reaction: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB)'s wait for an Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 trophy continues. The team has participated in every season of the competition since its inception but has not yet managed to get hold of the trophy even once. With six wins in a row to get to the IPL 2024 Playoffs, it looked like RCB could well be the team to beat in IPL 2024 Playoffs but they stumbled yet again.RCB lost the IPL 2024 Eliminator against Rajasthan Royals (RR) by 4 wickets. Post the match, Virat Kohli, the man who has played every season of the tournament with the same franchise, appeared disappointed. However, it was Anushka Sharma's heartbroken reaction after her husband Kohli and RCB's fate in IPL 2024 was sealed. The video has quickly gone viral on social media.READ HERE | Virat Kohli's RCB Claim Unwanted Playoffs Record Following Defeat To RR In IPL 2024 EliminatorTake a look at the video here:Anushka Sharma yesterday at the Narendra Modi Stadium to support Virat Kohli and RCB team ❤️ pic.twitter.com/s30GtVW5uu— Virat Kohli Fan Club (@Trend_VKohli) May 23, 2024Virat Kohli Likely To Finish IPL 2024 As Leading Run-GetterAs far as Kohli is concerned, the right-handed batter is likely to finish as IPL 2024's leading run-scorer even though RCB will not be playing any further part in the competition.The right-handed batter finished with 741 runs from 15 innings, 147 more than Riyan Parag, the Rajasthan Royals (RR) star whose team is still alive in the competition. Sunrisers Hyderabad's (SRH) Travis Head has 533 which means unless something dramatic happens, Kohli will win the Orange Cap in the season.ALSO READ | IND vs PAK T20 World Cup 2024 Ticket Priced At $20,000? Lalit Modi Slams ICCKohli's next cricketing assignment will be India's T20 World Cup 2024 campaign. India are set to begin their campaign on June 5 before their marquee clash against Pakistan in New York on June 9 at the Nassau International Cricket Stadium.
